step1.sentence: Nobody expected her to win the competition — she was a real dark horse.

step2.story: The annual sales competition had the usual top performers leading the pack. But in the final week, a quiet analyst from the regional office surged ahead and took the prize. Everyone was stunned — she had been a dark horse all along.

step3.story: Marcus had been running for student council president for weeks, putting up posters and giving passionate speeches. He was sure he had it in the bag. Then on election day, a transfer student named Jia, who had barely spoken in class, won by a landslide. Nobody had seen it coming. Jia turned out to be a dark horse who had quietly built connections by helping classmates one-on-one with their struggles. Marcus learned that day that leadership isn't always loud — sometimes the quietest people make the biggest impact.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '어두운 말'로, 정체를 알 수 없는 경주마를 뜻합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 예상 밖의 강자나 숨겨진 실력자를 가리킬 때 사용합니다. 대회, 선거, 경쟁 상황에서 주목받지 못하다가 놀라운 성과를 내는 사람을 표현합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 19세기 영국 경마에서 유래했습니다. 벤저민 디즈레일리의 소설 'The Young Duke'(1831)에서 아무도 모르는 말이 경주에서 이기는 장면에 처음 등장했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 대체로 긍정적인 뉘앙스로, 숨은 실력자에 대한 놀라움과 감탄을 담고 있습니다. 한국어의 '다크호스'와 거의 같은 느낌으로 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The new intern turned out to be a dark horse in the coding challenge.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 신입 인턴이 코딩 챌린지에서 다크호스로 떠올랐다.
